channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish pile building - keeps growing, 15th February
item.description:
There is a pile of rubbish that has been growing for the last two weeks, started off with cardboard boxes, grew to furniture and mattress as you can see. At one point there was a needle within the stack of rubbish. Unsure what is happening to it. As said it’s been growing for a couple weeks now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 408, York Way, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass scattered across public footpath, 15th February
item.description:
There has been belongings left outside the property for ‘people to take’ by unknown. There was glass amongst the things which have been smashed across the footpath. Belongings have been there since Friday 13th and glass smashed anywhere between Saturday Night and today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 408, York Way, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This pile of rubbish is only getting bigger, 15th February
item.description:
After council introduced rubbish clearance every 2 weeks it’s only gotten worse. I get a pleasant surprise if don’t see newly dumped rubbish laying around when go to work in the morning. It’s that bad!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several Park lights not working, 15th February
item.description:

item.title: Extremely Large Pothole, 15th February
item.description:
This pothole is a car killer. I, along with others, have lost tyres because of it. The hole is just on the exit of a speed bump, so it’s very hard to see it. This is extremely dangerous and needs sorting as soon as possible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road badly pavemented, 15th February
item.description:
Good Evening I cycle every morning to get to Hither Green station and I had several near misses accident on Torridon Road, because the road is very bad pavemented. The side of Torridon Road that is near Springbank road. Please can this be checked and fixed to avoid cyclist having n accident? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torridon Road, Hither Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Number 73 .. this building is a former pub on the corner of garfton and warden roads. on the grafton road side there is a driveway and the drain is by that driveway, 15th February

item.title: Parked vehicle blocking pavement, 15th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheldon Avenue, Muswell Hill, Greater London

item.title: Huge volumes, 15th February
item.description:
Of litter clogging greenery and the drains and gutters are blocked , it’s been like it for years and the wet wether is making it worse , this needs clearing , it can not be left to local residents to sort out as the road will need to be made safe . A terrible spot for such filth as it’s beside the cemetery and shows the council has not a hint of pride in such an important borough entrance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Avery Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole - multiple people reporting damage to tyres when driving over it., 15th February

item.title: Outside Prezzo by pedestrian crossing. - Euston Road, 15th February
item.description:
Every year this is an issue. It Rais and this drain gets blocked and floods. This blocks 1-2 lanes on the westbound direction. Camden Council & TfL please sort this out! It’s shameful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Euston Road, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
